body: Is that AutoFac? Can you access the container from inside that lambda?
I think there are a few issues going on. I added a breaking unit test ^^ for at least one of the issues. Let me verify that they all fail for the same reason.

@jbogard just confirmed that all my models are slightly different but they all have that custom dictionary with methods defined.. They all fail with the same exception :(.

I tried making the failing test as simple as possible. Here is the full class if you need it: https://github.com/exceptionless/Exceptionless/blob/master/Source/Core/Models/Collections/DataDictionary.cs

Work around is make `DataDictionary<TKey,TValue> : Dictionary<TKey, TValue>` and specify object and string and it should work.

Issue is that it's not generic and `TypeHelper.GetElementTypes` finds KeyValuePair instead of string and object.
I'm reverting back to 4.x for now, I appreciate the work around but it won't work for us.
Any ideas when this would get fixed in 5.x? We could really use the perf improvements?
seems like simple enough fix.  Question is when will the next nuget build have an official release.
I can use a nightly :) as long as it's stable :)

Ah, have you tried it?

On Wed, Jul 13, 2016 at 3:01 PM, Blake Niemyjski notifications@github.com
wrote:

> I can use a nightly :)

Ah duh. I saw that #1418 was fixed.
Nope that's something different.  I did look for that as my first guess, but it's different issue.  Very similar though I will admit.

issue.title: ExpandoObject is a dictionary and should be mapped as such
issue.body:
#1418 and #1518 are the same issue (as the numbers clearly suggest).
#1520 fixes both.
#1430 is not needed.

body: @niemyjski MyGet feed has fix now btw,
